website_summaries.verdict: If you're searching for stellar-sounding in-ear headphones that won't lighten your wallet quite as much as the Shure SE530, the Ultimate Ears Triple.fi 10 earphones fit the bill--just make sure the gigantic earbuds fit in your ears.
pros: The Ultimate Ears Triple.fi 10 earphones have a high-quality build and stylish earbud housing
offers excellent audio quality thanks to the three individual speakers in each ear piece
comes with a two-year warranty, a nice case, and plenty of other accessories
cons: The Ultimate Ears Triple.fi 10 earphones are expensive and the ear pieces are huge, which will cause comfort and fit issues for some

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner's IEMs
customer_reviews.text: I have owned these for over 10 years and they are still some of the best IEMs that I have. The only downside is the wires will wear so you have to buy new cables. The cables are typically cheap and there are lots of third-party options that go amazing with these. For the price, these IEMs are great for a first pair and eventually, you can upgrade to the $1000+ range once you can afford them. These outperform a lot of what there is on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crappy construction going on at UE
customer_reviews.text: These IEM sound ok. My two gripes are with the construction. They will not stay inserted in my ear no matter what size silicone ear cushions I use, I have to push them back into my ear about every 3 minutes. My ears suffer from real pain after 20 minutes. This is the third pair of UE IEM's I've used and all have shorted out to one ear or both. If I bend the cable a little the volume goes way up, then does way down when the cable flexes back. Crappy construction going on at UE, and I do not suggest this brand. On the bright side, these have removable cables and it's easy enough to get better replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn T. Bell

customer_reviews.title: These are some seriously amazing headphones. After three years of ownership
customer_reviews.text: These are some seriously amazing headphones. After three years of ownership, they're going strong and they're still my go-to set when I need some serious sound. I've had to replace the audio cable just once, but since these are built to detach, I didn't have to throw the whole thing out. Word of note: these work best with an audio amplifier - audio amps built into most phones and other portables just don't have the juice to drive these 100%. And get the comply foam tips (I get the wax guard version) - they're fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: The product I received was not genuine. I was in the navy and on deplyment using them and the left ear bud just stopped working. When I contacted the company they informed me I had been sold a knock off pair.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Earbuds (Almost) Perfected!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! ...If they were to actually stay in my ears. These earbuds have a great sound, but despite putting the smallest sized tips on they still don't actually form a proper seal and physically stay in my ears. My guess is the housing is so large and makes each earbud heavy. It's frustrating to have paid so much for a product that isn't the most usable due to its design. I'm going to be getting some third party memory foam tips to see if that improves things.
customer_reviews.author: seeker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, with a couple of (possible) caveats
customer_reviews.text: The sound is neutral (in a good way), they don't require amplification, arguably the best in-ears I've ever had (and I went through quite a few). Perfect, basically. Now, the caveats: - Anything will drive them just fine, but I would suggest adding something like Meridian Explorer to really open them up. - If you like your bass rich, stay away. These are not "lean"... simply *neutral*. - The cable feels insubstantial and cheap. I only use them in my office, and so far so good, but they do not feel particularly robust for the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must read
customer_reviews.text: Perfect hearing for audio engineer, but with the past of years the plastic turns nondurable, i have to stick the broken parts of the housing. because i feel so satisfied with the quality of the components. that i didn't expect to change it.
customer_reviews.author: Kendrys H. Audio Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, not good reliability.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best-sounding earphones (not headphones). But the longevity/reliability is questionable. One of the speakers/drivers inside broke within the 1st year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Audiophile

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound, Bad durability
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review makes me terribly sad. I'll start by saying that these are by far the best ear buds I have ever used. The fit and sound quality are truly impressive. BUT, went through 3 different sets of cables during the one year I used them. I bought a different replacement cable each time, same results. This amasses to nearly $90 in cables alone. The great performance of these headphones is overshadowed by its massive durability flaws.
customer_reviews.author: B&A

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are the best headphones I've ever used. They're also the most expensive headphones I've never used. I have no idea why I've been using junk $30-$50 headphones when I could have simply just saved up money and gotten these headphones instead. The Sennhesier CX500s I was using before were no joke. They sounded pretty amazing for $40 headphones. They provided a lot more bass than the Triple-Fi's do, but the clarity the Triple-Fis give completely destroy the CX500s. I'm glad I saved up my money to get these things. While I've only had these headphones for a few days, I hope the cables don't give out like many of the ones that other reviewers have talked about.
customer_reviews.author: Trung Dinh

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds...
customer_reviews.text: Although the original MSRP of these earbuds was $399.99, a year later at less than half that (<$150) I can't be happier. The sound quality surpasses that of what I've come to expect from Ultimate Ears. Although the company is still evolving since its Logitech takeover, it seems to be for the better. I expect their new line, highlighted by the high-end UE 900 earbuds, are similarly in quality. The latter set has new technology including quad-armature design, where as the triplefi 10's only have 3 speakers. Again though, at the price these are found now, they are amazing in performance and quality.
customer_reviews.author: leanbeanjean

customer_reviews.title: These are hands down the best headphones I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a couple pairs of these TripleFi 10s over the years and still use them almost daily. These are hands down the best headphones I've owned. After many 1000+ hours of use I'm still raving about these headphones. If I could get the same sound quality in a pair of wireless headphones I'd buy them no matter how ugly they were. I'm glad to see people are still buying and appreciating such an amazing pair of audiophile quality headphones. These headphones are made for the serious audiophiles among us who appreciate hearing music the way it was supposed to sound.
customer_reviews.author: Ed the Educated Consumer

customer_reviews.title: excellent all around sound and build quality
customer_reviews.text: Just got these on Black Friday sale for $95 - amazing price and thanks Amazon. I used these with the large rubber cones and got great sound seal and bass. I really like the over ear wire mounting as well. Very comfortable and provides better support. Not going to be able to lay on your sides with these, but great for general listening and working out. I also bought a pair of Klipsh X10s at same sale price, and the UE Triple Fi's are warmer with fuller midrange. Both are very good, but I think I prefer these a bit more. Highly recommend these, even at the non Black Friday sale regular price.
customer_reviews.author: M. allen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the TripleFi 10s after coming from a lesser pair of UEs that I used for years and loved. The upgrade was well worth the extra cost, my ears thank me. As always with any in-ear monitors, there’s always the issue of keeping them clean. I found if you store them in an air-tight container with some silica packets or similar anti-moisture thingies from medicine bottles, it’ll keep the ear stink away. Update: the left ear stopped working for whatever reason and I received a refund rather than a replacement because they were no longer being made. I used that to go towards UE’s latest UE900s which are even more impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Coma

customer_reviews.title: Nice earphone
customer_reviews.text: This IEM worth $200 but probably not more than that, I paid around $160 + shipping. The sound quality is pretty good compare to other IEM, definitely beats the beats iem. :) Only problem with this IEM is the annoying cable, both left and right cables join just below my chin and sometimes it touches or choke my neck. Deal breaker if I knew this before, but oh well, I can probably spend $50 on the alternate cables. If you can find Westone 3 or 4 at $200 I say get those, otherwise this IEM is not bad for under $200.
customer_reviews.author: Yoda

customer_reviews.title: OK. But not for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Cans: Audeze LCD-2, Denon D2000, Brainwavz M5, Sony Xb90ex Pros: Great detail and quality sound Cons: warm warm warm sound. Music feels cramped like there's not enough space to go around. Final thoughts: I find myself enjoying the Sony XB90EX more. (1/3d of the price....) I can't even compare these to the d2000 or lcd2.
customer_reviews.author: R. Litorja

customer_reviews.title: Sound amazing, but HUGE
customer_reviews.text: Got these on gold box deal for about $100. They sound really incredible. But I didn't do enough research to realize how huge they are. They stick out of your ears. Luckily I have long hair which covers them. The size also makes wearing a winter hat uncomfortable. They're also kind of heavy. I replaced the cable with one with a mic for use with my iPhone. Overall, I'm not unhappy, though had I had a true appreciation for their size, I may have opted for something smaller. There's no shortage of options out there. (I'm a medium sized woman.)
customer_reviews.author: George Eliot

customer_reviews.title: crisp n clean
customer_reviews.text: I just got myn today and as soon as I turnd on my ipod touch even the click sound of it switching on had a real ctisp clear click sound. needles to say the music was evry bit as clear and crisp. Iv had DR drey beats and they fell apart then I got some bose and lost them but these have a beter sound then them both. Im not a sound expert geek so I cant say wy they sound so good I just know what I here and I here good clear crisp quality sound frome these.
customer_reviews.author: mickey bland

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, poor fit
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot. They sound great. I haven't had any of the problems with the cables as others have suggested, but I am very careful with my gear. The fit is not good. They protrude out very far and I had trouble getting a tip that was comfortable. The comply tips finally won out after I took my nose hair scissors to them to enlarge the hole to reduce the muddiness of the foam. I own some nice headphones like Sennheiser, Denon, and Klipsch. These are in that calibre of sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kungfuthug

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable, terrible warranty, worse customer service
customer_reviews.text: Loved the earphones until they broker (wire came loose and left earphone fell off). I had them for a little over a year and when I called for warranty I was told they didn't cover them past a year and that I couldn't even pay to fix it through them. Basically confirmed to me that they're just some expensive and now worthless earphones. In spite of the good sound quality, the customer service is atrocious and not worth the risk that you'll be out of luck if anything ever happens to them.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: All kinds of good. Very clean, and I have heard things in the music that I had not heard before. I did buy some new foamies (  ) to keep the wax out, but other than the fact they don't give you the ability to play the music, I have nothing bad to say about them.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn P

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate Sound Reproduction . . . !
customer_reviews.text: Soon i Received my Ultimate Ears i've unpack them and fix them to my IPhone the music were more alive & the sound reproduction is Awesome Triple, mid & woofer + the woofer thump is there, but fitting is not so good although it comes with multi-size silicon & comply foam but they easily fall down, not recommended for outdoor use, Can't say any thing more about the earphones, you've to try it your self to hear the Reference sound !
customer_reviews.author: Jasem M. A. Dashti

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Excellent
customer_reviews.text: The sounds from the headphones are very, very good. The bad-not the best fitting headphones. I find myself pushing them into my ear canal because they slip out periodically. If you are planning to use these while somewhat stationary, do give these great sounding headphones a try. If you are jogging or working out, I recommend doing more research and investing in a different pair.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jablonkay

customer_reviews.title: Best portable cans for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best portable cans for the money, just be sure to replace the cables as soon as the package arrives. The cables make these headphones sound half as good as they were built and using silver or silver plated copper cables makes these sound like much more expensive 'phones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these headphones on many a plane trip. These are so much better than the Bose I owned for a short while. Because these act like ear plugs, they really stop the sound. I have put these in, turned on some music and slept peacefully, even with screaming babies on board. The sound quality is just what you would expect from having 3 speakers in each ear. It really does sound as good as my home entertainment center.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: my first iem for years.
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago I found a fullsize can could be so great compare to ear bud or iem(comfortableness and sound qulity). So since than I throw away all my sony, sennheiser ear buds. Last month, finally I got this pair iem when amazon had that super deal. Its sound is great. But I still prefer my hd600 more. And it is the most comfortable iem I ever used. In only a few days I get used to it and basically feel nothing even if wearing for hours. Its convenience is incomparable with those full size cans. Finally when I want some music, I don't have to sit down and turn on amp, cd...
customer_reviews.author: buyer NJ

customer_reviews.title: Best impulsive buy ever.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was on sale. I thought I could buy it and put it up on ebay for profit. The moment I saw them, however, I knew I wanted to keep them. Everything was packaged nicely into a very professional looking box. The earphones came with everything you'd need for them. I've never been much of an audiophile before these earphones, but now that I've experienced what music is supposed to sound like, there's no turning back. Every little detail can be heard through these earphones. They are truly amazing. Would I ever buy these babies for $400? Sure, if I could afford them. They are definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. You will never go back to any headphone under $100. Clear highs, mids, and lows. Great for everything: Rock, Metal, Pop, Gangsta Rap, Country, etc. The only reason I won't give it a 5 is because they come with an angled 3.5 mm which is outdated because they don't fit in smartphone's with cases usually so you might have to modify your case to accommodate for this or take off the case entirely. The accessories are really nice an extension cord, carry case and a 1/4" to 3.5 mm jack is really high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: excellent audiophilegrade inears
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for an excellent price as a lightning deal to be used with my ipod filled with lossless music. Crystalclear highs, relaxed voices, tight bass, easily the best inears i own. Compared to some of my cheaper inears it is like a veil has been withdrawn from the music. I deduct 1 star because i can only get the necessary seal with the foam earpieces, with the other earpieces, the phones keep falling out of my ear and/or are very uncomfortable. Maybe my ears have a strange shape ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Transport to another dimension.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome!! The triple drivers gives a super clear sound and the balance of treble and bass is perfect. I recommend you use Comply foam tips. Just be careful, as these will block out all other sound. They work great on noisy airplanes and in other loud environments. Totally worth the high price.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald R Overmyer

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal! Excellent neutral sound stage.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal! Excellent neutral sound stage. Not required but even better with a headphone amp. Love them. Favorite IEMs. I have the Ultimate Ears Super.fi 5 Pro as well but the TripleFi 10's are even better. Got them years ago during an Amazon Black Friday sale for 99!
customer_reviews.author: K. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good.  Design is less so.
customer_reviews.text: They sound good. True to their claim, I've heard things in songs that I hadn't heard with other ear phones. The design is another issue. The cable is too thick, and likes to push the earphones out of my ear. And for in ear headphones, they stick really far out of the ear. I bought them when they were a gold box special. I wouldn't suggest paying full price for them.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Wood

customer_reviews.title: THE MOST AMAZING IEM'S.
customer_reviews.text: BUY THEM... 1.Clarity 2. Clear High's 2.Clean Low Bass 4.No Distortion I had mine for about 6 months until I lost them at the gym....or else I cherished them while I had them...bought another pair since I couldn't find anything else on the market that came even close to the Level of clarity of these IEM's.
customer_reviews.author: R.M

customer_reviews.title: Cable failure x 2
customer_reviews.text: Original cable failed in ten months and was replaced under warranty. The replacement cable lasted about 9 months. I've had to purchase a third set outside of the warranty (went with a alternate brand of cable) For such an expensive component, the build quality of the cable is just really poor. These headphone are either in use, or coiled into the hard carry case. I never just bunch up the wires and shove in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable in my ears although Sure (brand) tips help the ...
customer_reviews.text: Accurate sound reproduction. Zero exaggerated bass. Not very comfortable in my ears although Sure (brand) tips help the comfort a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: John Biccum

customer_reviews.title: Do not get microphone version!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought these with the microphone. Whenever you move at all - there is a rustling sound coming in through the microphone - then when you go out, EVERYTHING is broadcast through the microphone when you are trying to shut out the world. If you want to call their clueless tech support in the Philippines and listen to the most painful music ever on hold...you will find out you can only disable the microphone when using a PC. IF you are using these for calling...they are too good for that - and the mic will ruin your experience when offline. Now need to see about returning to Amazon and getting the ones without a mic
customer_reviews.author: George Lange

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of this as a Christmas gift for myself. The audio quality is tremendous--when you have them fitted in your ears properly. If they wiggle out or lose their snug fit, they lose a lot of fidelity and admit background sound. They are expensive... But if you want quality sound and can stand to fit them properly to your ears, you will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: bubba bubba

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The price was too good to pass up (Less than $100). I bought my original pair nearly 4 years ago and they still perform flawlessly. Don't expect to get sound quality similar to closed ear headphones, but the overall sound is very good. I use mine when I travel. The headphone come in a very nice metal travel case. The construction is first rate. I would recommend them even at the retail price of $400, which is what I paid for them nearly 4 years ago. To purchase them for $100, "priceless".
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Guerra, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sound, but didn't stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.text: I got these years ago for a super bargain price of $179. They sound amazing but after a few short years one of the buds stopped working properly and wouldn't play full volume without cable jiggling acrobatics. I wouldn't pay more than $200 for these... also I think the Shure SE530s sound better but they are much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: they used to be better made
customer_reviews.text: Logitech bought this company and now it's just not as good. I had a pair of the old ones, they were wonderful, great great audio quality and you could use them to talk on your iPhone too. the sound quality on these is comparable, but they're a little flimsier than they used to be, and at this price point that's pretty sketchy.
customer_reviews.author: resonance

customer_reviews.title: The Best Non-Custom earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best sounding non-custom earbuds that you can buy. You realize what you've been missing after you wear these for a while. Clearest highs with an incredible low end. At the GoldBox price of $100 it was a steal. Easily worth over $300. I also own 2 pairs of Super.fi 5 Pros and use them for mixing music at home. I've had to replace the cable on the Super.fi 5 Pros once before, after a couple of years though. No big deal. I'll see how the cable on this pair holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Hammurabi

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, a defective plug kept me from enjoying them
customer_reviews.text: Received these today, unpacked, and plugged them in. Immediately noticed no sound coming from right earphone. Wiggling the cable where it meets the plug resulted in intermittent sound from right earphone. Tried out on a couple devices just to make sure it wasn't a headphone jack causing the problem. After reading the fantastic reviews regarding the sound quality I was hoping to not have any problems with the cable/plug as others have reported. Alas, within 20 minutes these were packed up and ready for return. Decided to order a pair of the Etymotic Research ER-4P earphones instead.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: One of the best earbuds in the world
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Good sound quality Good build quality Plenty of accessories Good noise isolation (worked great on the airplane) Con: Ear pieces are huge, may not comfortable for some Frequency range up to 17kHz on the spec. Not 20kHz compares to other earbuds (But not effect a lot while listening) One of the best in Ear Headphones in the world With a high quality recording you can hear huge dynamic range and clear detail. It is pretty airy for earbuds. Decent bass, fast response.
customer_reviews.author: eVOLBarista

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but will not last
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds sound fantastic. However, unless you plan on buying a new pair every 2-3 years forget it. The wiring is cheap and will either short out or break completely with regular use. It is too bad because they really are great sounding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not fit to your ears.
customer_reviews.text: This earphones have a great sound but they have a little problem, they do not fit to my ears, I have tried all the tips cushion that they brought but two of them have been damaged in one week, another thing is the mini plug extension that not came with the package, I think someone grab it when he have packaged the product. I just have one week with them and I feel very disappointed and I am thinking in sell them and buy another one. I would like to receive an answer from the sellers because is annoying this situation besides that these earphones are expensive and overall I am not comfortable with them.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: The last legacy of Jerry Harvey
customer_reviews.text: The last legacy of Jerry Harvey, which I believe he designed the TripleFi 10 before Ultimate Ears was sold to Logitech. This pair of In Ear Monitors will always be a legend.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Close to perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've heard some of the other earbuds, like Future Sonics M5,W4R,IE80,SE535,SE846,UE900,IM03+HDC5,W40,W60. This triplefi is a masterpiece,the perfect high and low frequency,It is worth mentioning it instrument performance is unrivalled. Jerry Harvey,what an incredible man!This amazing iem was born ten years ago,but until now does not fall behind even more outstanding. Its weakness is only one that is the wearing comfort,need your ear hole to adapt it.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: review after having the product for over a year.
customer_reviews.text: This headphone is very nice built, I can's say solid, and it doesn't have to. They are goos enough for everyday use and they clearity of this thing, is the best I have ever tried. Way more clear the any of the BEATS. the bass mid and high are fairly even, but they are very clear, you can definitely hear things you couldn't from other headphones.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Earphones
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a good number of earphones, ranging in price from 79 to 299. These are by far the best. Their sound is spectacular, whether you like listening to classical music or hard rock. They are well made, their ear pieces fit in snugly, and the cord is well measured and robust. I doubt you'll find better ones at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Ogel

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these about 3 years ago and have been using them ever since. These by far are the best sounding personal listening devices on the market. I don't need to have those big and bulky over the ear headphones. Go for the devices that have great HIGHS, MIDDLES AND LOWS! Plus they do isolate noise. I used them when I travel and have drowned out crying babies. The great thing about these devices is that you do not need to turn your music up past half way to get great sound. I highly recommend these earphones.
customer_reviews.author: LDH

customer_reviews.title: Eargasm
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of people have already reviewed these so I will give you the abbreviated version. Answer These 3 questions: Do you use in ear headphones? Do you like listening to music? Can you spare a few hundred dollars? If you said yes to any of these questions... BUY THEM NOW. You will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben T Talley

customer_reviews.title: awesome, just awesome
customer_reviews.text: even at the price of $185, buy them now. before the price goes back up to where it usually is. at this price range, no other pair of IEM earphones come close. clarity is brilliant, bass is smooth and highs warm. usually with average 'high end' IEMs, the highs are still screechy, as if a tweeter was mounted on the bottom of an empty soda can firing downward at great volume or the bass is muffled as if a large pillow was thrown over the bass woofer and it sent the cat fleeing. not in this case, clarity is spot on. music is clear and precise, if you play low-end mp3, you will notice. cheers.
customer_reviews.author: rosco

customer_reviews.title: Blows away the competition for it's price point
customer_reviews.text: The TripleFi 10s are a fantastic set of earphones. I've had two pair for over two years and they still sound great. My only complaint is that the cables are very stiff, but they are strong too. I admittedly beat them up (use at the gym and running) and they have not shown any signs of wear or connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Murray

customer_reviews.title: It worked well for ~ 6 months, then.......
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for ~ 6 months, I mean, really well. The sound quality is so different that everyone who gives a trial can tell. Unfortunately, one of earphones stopped working periodically due to cable issues. I have to bend it to a certain angle to get it work. Not surprisingly, this didn't last long and it completely died after another couple of months. This is way too short for such a price.
customer_reviews.author: crazyweed

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to earphone, sound quality obviously is your top consideration and let me tell you, it worth very penny. It's better than other $300 $400 earphones. if this sound does not satisfy you, then you could save time looking for others because there is no one better unless you wanna go for $1000 or something. The the outlook is cute too and cable is thicker than most other headphones so it hard to tangle. The only complain I have is that the ear tip is not soft enough for me, and foam tips is also too big but they can be replaceable so not much of a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: UE tf 10, in this price range, you can't find other better then this one.
customer_reviews.text: I have many expensive Earphone, IE 80, JVC FX800, JVC FXZ 200, shure SE 535, and this ue tf 10, this one is my favor. my love, you can see other review say how good of this UE tf 10, It was saleing $499 in 2009, for now the price 60% down, just $199, for the sound quality, in this price you can have this hi end earphone. go for it , and this the classic earphone, if u love earphone, u should this!!
customer_reviews.author: Ray zhen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent isolation and sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: When I received the product, I had trouble fitting the buds into my ears. A quick look online, and I learned what the proper technique was. After that, it was excellent. For the isolation these canal phones provide, along with the impressive frequency response for their size, they make excellent on-the-go devices for critical listening or drowning out the other schmoes on the plane.
customer_reviews.author: WHY

customer_reviews.title: The best sounding, but not the best fit
customer_reviews.text: While they stay in the ears snugly, over the course of an hour or so, they can become quite uncomfortable to wear. Nothing sounds better, but it's hard to keep them in when they're making your ear canal sore.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Byrnes

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: At the $200 dollar range these headphones are light years beyond the rest. The treble is very good--even compared to top-tier earphones that are $100 more. Bass is also very nice; not so much in quantity, but in quality. It has a punch and impact to it that goes well with electronic music. Mids, on the other hand, are not the best with the TripleFi 10's. They are too recessed for my liking in indie and folk songs. Build quality is very sturdy for the wire and also the actual housing. My one negative about the TripleFi's is that they are quite big and stick out of your ear. Overall a great buy and would highly recommend to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Dio

customer_reviews.title: Good sound a little bulky
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I bought these headphones they sound great, not as much bass as some other ones but good highs and clear vocals. They are a little big and the way they wrap around the ear took some getting used to. But they stay in my ear and I like them.
customer_reviews.author: nydunes

customer_reviews.title: Time to experience music.
customer_reviews.text: Get the right stuff and get it done. Only comment would be how the metal parts near the buds start to poke out of the plastic black wrapping. Not a big deal. Just needs some black electrical tape and its good to go. Amazing sound from these things. Great deal too.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Amazing IEM's at an amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: Great ears, great price. Great service. We use several pairs of Triple Fi-10's as in ear monitors (IEM's) for our church. I have yet to find a better pair of IEM's at this price. Now that UE has stopped making them they are harder to find. The UE 900 replaced them but cannot be found for the same price as the Trip-Fi-10's.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Smith

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received mine couple days late because UPS decided to leave my entire order on my porch at 940pm. I must admit they are great for delivering so late and being so considerate as to being afraid of awakening us from our sleep. Its all right amazon took care of me and shipped it out next day. So I was only out 2 days. These are awesome. I am no audiophile but man do I love my music more and more each day. These are really good headphones. Manufacturing standards could be better but as long as the music sounds good. I am good. So glad I got these instead of the Kiplsch x10 images.
customer_reviews.author: von

customer_reviews.title: Great sound poor fit
customer_reviews.text: These have amazing sound when I could get them in my ears right. They’re a total pain to get just right. I have smaller ears so it could just be for that reason but they would never stay in my ear right. Got rid of them after 2 weeks of owing.
customer_reviews.author: N. Maggio

customer_reviews.title: Music to my ears
customer_reviews.text: If you are reading this review.. dont bother.. just go buy them. They are AMAZING! I have these paired with a Fiio E7 :D CONS: If its your first pair of quality headphones.. everything else is going to sound like crap. So dont lose them!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality but......
customer_reviews.text: I got these when it went on sale for $99. I have to say that the sound is great and well balanced. Unfortunately you have to have large ears for this to fit in...been using the smallest tip included but it just falls off my ears...
customer_reviews.author: theCURE

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: Really good sound if you can get a seal. With the comply foam tips, you will forget they are in your ears. The sound stage is wide too, a little bit like AKG 702. The treble isn't as harsh as the AKGS and the bass is decent. The only con I can think so far is that the cable will probably knot up if you just stick them in your pockets, so you have to remember to wrap it around something and stick it in that tin.
customer_reviews.author: Nguyen Hoang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Wow...
customer_reviews.text: Got it on Black Friday. Because of the crappy shipping only got it today. Right after I got it I put it on my Touch and started to play some postrock music that I really loved. I've had some low/mid end IEMs and this one is much better! I am hearing more details and shifts that I've never noticed before! And I love the Bass level. Isn't too much but you can tell it's there. The only down side is that sometimes I wear glasses. So far I've been trying to avoid any kind of over the ear stuff. Guess will wait and see. Now off to jogging and doing a little burn in.
customer_reviews.author: Meng Wang

customer_reviews.title: Best Buds
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of ear buds. These are the best to date. Only one criticism, the cord broke several times, oh yeah, the dog ate one side of the first set...... Once they are burned in, the sound is unbelievably precise.
customer_reviews.author: PastorMichael

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 13 months of (light use) ownership
customer_reviews.text: Had UE phones before and always like the sound. No issues with the sound with this model - but build quality left A LOT to be desired, seeing how it JUST BROKE. This is with light usage (rotating between Monster Miles Davis phones and Senn HD600 cans). The tip that the rubber ear plug connects to broke off from the body. Looks like it was glued on; maybe I can do the same. Past the one year warranty but Ill see if Logitech will fix anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Poor compared to my old Westones
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a replacement for the Westone 4s that my cat ate. They must have spoiled me. The sound on the Ultimates is distinctly inferior. The bass is far too dominant. The high frequencies don't seem to be all there. Passages that once were clear now sound muddy. I'm just glad I didn't pay full price for them. If you can spring for the Westones do so. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 4 years later and I still love these headphones. Superb sound!
customer_reviews.author: Mr J

customer_reviews.title: My sweet music is now CLEAR
customer_reviews.text: I really felt that I'm INSIDE my music! .. I hear every single instrument, every single background sound , EVERYTHING IS CLEAR like never before! it's like what i was doing before was listening to my music from behind a thick wall. at the beginning i was thinking of going with BOSE IE2 (read many positive reviews about it) but when I saw amazon's 58% offer on those I thought that spending extra 68 bucks to get luxurious $400-worthy earbuds may be a good idea, and it was the right decision. I really LOVE those great earbuds and strongly recommend them to any music lover who want to rediscover the sweetness of his/her music.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Ismail

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound and not very comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: I would not have bought it without Black Friday sale. I am sure the earphones cost their $300 but I was not going to pay so much for them. Now I can say that the sound is the best among all in-ear headsets that I have heard. That's not surprising because they all were below $100. The sound is not quite armature-like, it's more like produced by dynamic driver earphones. Noise isolation is quite good - enough for noisy Russian subway. The fit is a little strange - they stick out of your ears for about 2cm. It's much more convenient to change right and left one with each other and wear them this way.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: and good build (minus the cables)
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding sound quality, and good build (minus the cables). I love them so much I bought a second pair just in case something terrible happens to the first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my TF10s
customer_reviews.text: UE TF10s are phenomenal IEMs for the money. While they're overpriced at $399, they are a great deal under $200. The sound is tops among anything else in this price range. Many complain about the fit, but there are so many options with different tips to try. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RDLMV

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I loved them but had to replace them since they are discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Persevere
customer_reviews.text: I bought these knowing there were going to be fit issues, but it was still a struggle. The silicone tips they give you are useless. They don't stay in your ear at all. However, the foam tips are excellent. They take a while to master and fit properly, and with the cable over your ear, they are not the most attractive earphone. However, with the foam tips on, the sound is excellent!! Massive bass when you turn the volume up, yet no one around can hear your music. I paid $194 for them, and would not pay a cent more. But have not regretted my purchase. Note, $20 for 2 pairs of foam tips if you want to buy extras.
customer_reviews.author: Trial and error

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for In-Ear monitor use and general listening
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing! I use them as in-ear monitors when playing drums in live venues (usually churches), in addition to general listening on my computer or my iPhone. The jack on the headphones is case-friendly (works with cases like the otter box that cause the iPhone headphone port to be recessed). These headphones have great fidelity and fit very snug in the ear. I recommend getting Comply wax-guard foam tips to protect the headphones from getting waxed, as it will happen to these if you do not use wax-guards. They hold up very well. I have owned mine now for 2 years. A recommended buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Freakin awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously these are way cheaper than the competition and handle very well and sound super clear. Only gripe I would have is the shape and how they kind of jut out of your head. other than that very satisfied with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Hubert Cumberdale

customer_reviews.title: Owned these since 2006
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these headphones -- the first being bought in 2006. I bought these again in 2012 even though they are discontinued. Why? Because UE is now owned by Logitech, and now only their ultra-premium models offer the replaceable cables that make these headphones so amazing. That feature alone makes these head and shoulders better than the Shure, Bose, Beatz with a z, or whatever other brands' equivalent models.
customer_reviews.author: mark r

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile headphones
customer_reviews.text: The sound has grown on me. They are very sturdy. I bought my used on Amazon and they came with a third party set of wires. They broke and I bought some FiiO wires and they helped bring out the mids. I would recommend these headphones to any audiophile but for the casual listener you can find more comfortable headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Loughmiller Media

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic earphone~
customer_reviews.text: i bought it during the blackfriday , at a very good price. i want say this is a High-performance earphones with three speaker drivers per earpiece, delivering impressive detail and full-bodied sound across the entire spectrum, with roughly equivalent performance to company’s higher-priced custom earphones, and superior overall low-end performance to class-leading option at lower price point. Includes very nice carrying case, fit kit, and other accessories. Most aggressive price we’ve yet seen for a triple-driver earphone; professional quality sound, rendered almost affordable.
customer_reviews.author: caozhuangfei

customer_reviews.title: The sound on these is absolutely fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, the sound on these is very, very good. They're the best in-ear headphones I've heard, and I've heard a lot of them. They are quite light, and fit the ear well, and sound fantastic. I've only had them for a month so I haven't had adequate change to evaluate durability.... but if you want rich, fantastic sound quality, you can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: love them! highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: exceptional audio quality and fit! some of the best out there. third party cables improve already great sound! highly recommended~!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Adkins

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I just got these yesterday and i have been listening to them constantly since. i never knew what my music was supposed to sound like until i put these on for the first time. i have never listened to music sound so amazing until i got my hands on these. from hip hop to classic rock, everything sounded EXPONENTIALLY better compared to any other headphones i have tried. i have to agree with others that the cable is kind of a pain to deal with because it can take a few seconds to wrap these around your ears and "properly" put these bad boys on, but the quality of the sound makes it all worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Rozario

customer_reviews.title: WARNING! PURCHASE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
customer_reviews.text: This earphone is a godsend. Warning! Once you put these in your ears, it's gonna be very ahrd for you to take them off in a good way. You will not want to communicate with anyone because you are lost in your musical world. These ear phones take you away and sometimes I get lost in thought just to space out and let every musical note and beat hit my ear drums. I did not know how much I was missing out on sound qualiy before buying these. I can not comment on durability but amazon makes me so i guess it might break soon but idc. These last two weeks have been pure bliss.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN A WU

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were supposed to sound amazing at a reasonable price. They are reasonably priced, but they stick out of my ears farther than any other earbud I've tried, and don't sound any better than my old $30 Sonys, and not nearly as good as my Westone UM3x RCs.
customer_reviews.author: f.c.geil

customer_reviews.title: Wear for long periods without fatigue or discomfort...
customer_reviews.text: The fidelity and sound separation is such that you don't miss any sound at low volume. I wear them in the office to tune out distractions. These are the only IEMs I've ever had that I could wear for long periods without fatigue or discomfort. In a few months I will have had them for two years - no issues. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Xeption2RL

customer_reviews.title: Cords keeps breaking
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for about 10 months now and use it everyday for at least 8 hours. The sound is great and they are several steps above any ear buds you can buy for $20-$50. However, I've had to RMA the product back to Logitech/Ultimate Ears twice because the cord broke. At least they provide free shipping both ways for my product. Ultimate ears sells new cords on their site for $20+shipping, I am not looking forward to replacing my cord every 6-months. I suppose it is better then replacing the ear buds altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Jon N

customer_reviews.title: lousy cable ruins an otherwise great product
customer_reviews.text: The sound from these earphones is amazing! That being said, I bought my earphones only five months ago and the cable is already damaged near the connector. (audio from both channels is distorted or absent at times) It seems the cable is too delicate, even though I've been taking great care of these babies. I have no idea why the adapter is not a 90-degree type, since the straight model is more prone to bending in my pocket.... This contributes to the premature cable failure.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pompilio

customer_reviews.title: One of the all-time classic IEMs
customer_reviews.text: Great earphones - one of the all-time classics! The only negative is the slightly heavy V-shaped sound which just sometimes makes the treble border on being a bit harsh.
customer_reviews.author: CSGLinux

customer_reviews.title: A charming gem that introduces me to the another world of listening
customer_reviews.text: I used to listening music with hifi equipment that costs much more than portable device. I never believe the quality of portable device. But This earphone is amazing with sony mp3 player. I can enjoy the large scale dynamics and detail nuance of music with this small device. In order to enjoy properly, this earphone needs appropriate inserting pressure and eartips. Anyhow, I am very spoiled with the cost/performance of this earphone(amazon price is much less than list price). In next time, I can not buy other high end earphones (W3, SE530, etc.) with regular price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Synn

customer_reviews.title: Just ok. Didn't like nearly as well as my 5-year-old Shure e4c
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is so subjective - but to my ears these have plenty of bass but at the sacrifice of everything else - making them muddy sounding. I was hoping for much more. Maybe worth the Black Friday price I paid of ninety-five dollars but not a penny more. I'm sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley E. Thurber

customer_reviews.title: Best sound quality for a in-ear bud
customer_reviews.text: Great product at the Goldbox deal of $100. I've always used cheap $20-30 earbuds. These blow the cheap stuff out of the water. Fitting these buds is a bit tricky at first. I found that the needed to be turned into my ear for a tight fit. Build quality seems to be fine, although other reviewers have commented on it durability issues. Overall, I am happy with these though.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bratcher

customer_reviews.title: If you are frustated with the fit
customer_reviews.text: Initially when I tried out these earphones, either the left side or the right side kept falling out of my ear. I gave up after a while and put them away for a few months. Then I came across a video on YouTube for the über-expensive custom-fit earphones that demonstrated how to rotate the bud into your ear [...] Try out the different buds to optimize the fit. Also, it may take some trial and error to adjust the cord appropriately around your ears. After these adjustments, the earphones fit was very stable and the sound quality was exceptionally better.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Audiophile

customer_reviews.title: Awesome earphones!
customer_reviews.text: + Better sound than the countless cheap ones out there + Comfortable to wear + Replaceable wire - Crappy wire, I've already replace twice!!! :/ * I'm a pretty rough user - daily gym, constantly moving around, connected to phone that is always in my pocket. Decision: I'd buy these again only if I could find a durable replacement cord.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Le

customer_reviews.title: Clean Clear and Fun
customer_reviews.text: I really love this earphone, I been using it for about 2 years now. The high are crystal clear, the bass is deep and the mids are quite amazing and intimate. The instrument separation is great, I can totally envision in my head where every instrument is coming from. I had to experiment with the different tips and settled with the complys. The only negative I will give it, is that the cable can be a little softer so it's easier to manage. Other than that, this earphone is a winner!!
customer_reviews.author: Blur

customer_reviews.title: These sound great. Clear and detailed reproduction of the sound
customer_reviews.text: These sound great. Clear and detailed reproduction of the sound. As with all generic IEMs I find the foam tips to be far more comfortable. They do stick out of your ears a bit which makes them a bit awkward if snoozing on the train / plane. The cable (as is often the case) is fragile but is fully replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lush

customer_reviews.title: Fine at home but too noisey if I went for ...
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous headphone but mucho micro-phonics. Fine at home but too noisey if I went for a walk. Sold them for more than I bought them for on Black Friday so I'm not complaining at all.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Culloty

product_meta.title: Ultimate Ears TripleFi 10vi Noise Isolating Earphones w/ Microphone
product_meta.description:
Size:w/ MicrophoneThe TRIPLE.Fi is a high-end consumer earphone with integrated voice functionality that is based on the same technology and sound signature used in our custom monitors. The TRIPLE.Fi 10vi features integrated voice functionality and is specifically designed for use with the iPhone. A miniature high performance microphone allows for hands free phone calls. An in-line multi-function button answers and ends calls and controls music/video on iPhone. Inside the TRIPLE.Fi 10vi are three individually proprietary armature speakers that produce a full spectrum audio experience. The proprietary armature speakers are tuned for full and detailed bass while delivering crisp and clean highs. In addition, the noise isolating design reduces ambient interference and sound quality. The armature is embedded in an anodized aluminum housing that is both small and lightweight and is an aesthetic complement to the iPhone.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER




THE CHOICE OF 75% OF THE WORLD'S TOP TOURING MUSICIANS*
The world's top performing artists choose Ultimate Ears custom in-ear monitors for one reason—they are made to deliver the best fit and sound reproduction available. Ultimate Ears represents the culmination of years of experience designing, testing and refining professional in-ear monitors. Ultimate Ears brings this experience to every pair of earphones that they make. The unique sound signature of Ultimate Ears earphones has been tuned to be sonically accurate, yet musically impressive. The earphone designs and ear cushions create a soft, snug seal for long wearing comfort and noise isolation. And Ultimate Ears' sleek, refined designs complement your personal style—instead of overwhelming it. 



ULTIMATE EARS TRIPLEFI 10VI – STUDIO-GRADE EARPHONES WITH TRIPLE ARMATURE SPEAKERS.
Triple because it directs the low, mid and high frequencies to a separate speaker, a total of three in each ear. That means youll hear every layer of sound, every nuance, every detail. A musicians breathing. Fingers sliding across guitar frets. Yes, youll hear all that just as if the artist was before you performing it live. Its the sonic equivalent of sitting in the worlds best recording studio. And your calls will be as clear as if you were right there.












VOICE CAPABILITY
Built-in High Performance Microphone and Control Button:
Easily switch between making calls and enjoying music and video on your iPhone or BlackBerry (with a 3.5 mm jack). Answer or end a call with the push of a button, or double-click the control button to advance between tracks.




PRO-AUDIO SOUND QUALITY
Triple Armature Speaker Design with Passive Crossover:
Three individual armature speaker drivers reproduce low, mid and high frequencies for a sonically rich experience. Integrated passive-crossover directs the sound frequencies (low to high) to the appropriate speaker. Audio filters shape the sound for the closest experience to custom personal monitors available.

Immersion Sound Signature: 
Exclusive Immersion sound signature is tuned to provide a 3-D sound stage that makes you feel as though you are experiencing the quality, energy and emotion of a live performance.

Noise Isolation: 
Armature speaker design allows the earphones to fit naturally and comfortably inside your ear to create a more secure seal to block outside noise by up to 26 dB.

Frequency Range:
Super broad frequency range of 10Hz – 20kHz delivers cleaner, clearer mid and high tones.




PERSONAL STYLE
Finish: 
Gun metal blue earphone color with black cord for a unique and unmistakable appearance. Shapeable cord for a secure custom fit, like professional monitors.




LONG WEARING COMFORT
Customizable Fit: 
Shapeable cord can be worn over the ear for a secure customized fit, like professional monitors.

Comply Foam Ear Cushions:
Comply foam ear cushions provide maximum comfort and noise isolation. Available only on Ultimate Ears premium earphone models.

Soft Silicone Ear Cushions:
Includes small, medium and large silicone ear cushions to comfortably fit all ear sizes.



CONVENIENT FEATURES
Flexible Listening: 
Can be worn comfortably down for casual listening situations such as sitting or walking, or can be worn over the ear to keep the earphones securely in place during running or exercising. 

Tangle-Resistant Cord:
Durable cord is strong and does not tangle as easily as thinner ear bud cords. Cord length of 46” is specifically designed to prevent earphone fallout.

Pocket-Ready Hard Case:
Crush-proof brushed metallic hard case safely stores your earphones and slips easily into a pocket or bag.



COMPATIBILITY
Audio Players* iPod and other MP3 players iPhone and Blackberry (audio only) Home audio Gaming consoles Video/portable DVD players Computers/laptops 
*with 3.5mm jacks Mobile Phones* iPhone Blackberry Music Phones 
*with 3.5mm jacks 
WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Ultimate Ears TripleFi 10vi earphones with voice capability Crush-proof metallic hard case Soft, silicone ear cushions (S, M, L) In-line phone microphone and control button Two sets of Comply foam ear cushions Cleaning tool Extender cable Airline attenuator for hearing protection 1/4 inch adapter jack Instruction manual 1-year limited hardware warranty 
FIND YOUR ULTIMATE EARS
Good Better Best 

Model Speaker Design Noise Isolation Comfort Features Compatibility TripleFi 10 
Triple Armature Speaker Full 3D Sound Stage, Closest Experience to Our Custom In-Ear Monitors 
26 dB

Comply Foam & Silicone Ear Cushions Shapeable Cord for a Secure Custom Fit Audio: iPod, iPhone, & MP3 Voice & Audio: (vi Version):
iPhone, Blackberry and other Smart Phones Ultimate Ears 700


Dual Armature Speaker Optimized Frequency Response for More Precise Audio Reproduction & Punchy Bass 
26 dB 
Comply Foam & Tapered Silicone Ear Cushions Micro Design for Long Wearing Comfort  Audio: iPod, iPhone & MP3

SuperFi 5 
Single Top Fire Armature Speaker Extended High Frequency Response 
26 dB 
Comply Foam & Silicone Ear Cushions Audio: iPod, iPhone, & MP3 Voice & Audio: (vi Version):
iPhone, Blackberry and other Smart Phones SuperFi 4 
Single Armature Speaker Crisp Full Sound & Improved Noise Isolation 
26 dB 
Comply Foam & Silicone Ear Cushions  Audio: iPod, iPhone & MP3

MetroFi 220

16 dB

Noise isolating design attenuates outside noise by an amazing 26db

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars705 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
